response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}

Explanation: The issue with your original code is that you are creating a new iterator for each iteration of the loop, which means that you are only getting the first child value for each iteration. To fix this, you can use the iterator object within the loop and access the next value using the "next()" method instead of creating a new iterator every time. This will give you the correct value for each iteration.
